New feature to collapse regions of Java source - very nice.
The way I copy between files is to position the cursor to the start of the 
file, use Ctrl+Shift+End to select all of the text between cursor and EOF, or 
sometimes Shift+Arrow keys to highlight a selected region.
After this use Ctrl+C to copy into the clipboard.  The collapsed regions are 
not included.
Using Edit>Select All to select the file's contents does work, but holding 
down the shift key and using the keyboard arrows or Ctrl+End to traverse the 
selection cursor over collapsed regions doesn't pick up the collapsed bits.

Using Ctrl+Shift+End on 3.0 RC2 I get:

Created an attachment (id=12380)
Proposed solution

The Previous/NextSubwordActions do not check whether the new caret position is
visible. The attached patch fixes this and repeatedly searches for the
previous/next subword until a visible position is found. For the
DeletePrevious/NextSubwordActions the old behaviour is conserved.

Note that I could not reproduce the problem from comment 0, only the exception
from comment 1, which occurs on ctrl-arrowkey navigation/selection, not on
ctrl-end. The patch fixes this.

Tom, FYI: I tried taking your suggestions into account, but found the patch to
become too complicated and now posted my original version, which loops until it
finds a visible position.

Verified that I can do shift-ctrl-arrow left/right shift-arrow left/right,
ctrl-end and ctrl-shift-end across folded regions and ctrl-c works correctly.
